2024-09-28T17:28:13Z,newgraph_lschick,newgraph_lschick,newgraph_lschick,Bulkley River ,Upper Bulkley by Topley          ,4.7,7.9,294,clear,low,,,9,,,19,22,2024-09-28T17:34:53Z,8.5,19,2024-09-28T19:20:39Z,16,25,2024-09-28T20:08:41Z,,,,,,,,,,,,,1,2024-09-28T19:21:37Z,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,"Top of site waypoint 388. Bottom of sight waypoint 389. Walk the whole length of the stream between those two waypoints roughly 3-4 km. Pretty decent habitat with frequent beaver dams, slowing down the flow and raising the water level, all passable to fish. Fry spotted the entire length of the survey. Middle section runs through agricultural fields. Potential restoration site located at our waypoint number 94, where the fencing is falling into the stream and the right bank is eroding with signs of cattle use. Would be a good place for fencing and a potential watering hole for the cattle See photos. 2024-10-01T18:36:51Z,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,Buck Creek,buck_upper1,,,,,moderate,,,9,,,11,21,,11.5,15,,6,19,,,,,,,,,,,,,,1,,1,,1,,,,1.2,,1.2,,0.7,,1.3,2024-10-01T18:40:20Z,0.8,2024-10-01T18:43:45Z,1.2,2024-10-01T18:55:41Z,,,1.5,2024-10-01T19:03:58Z,,,,,,,,,"Card was started on Lucy‘s phone so some data may need to be transferred. Accessed the stream from the top of high canyon easily on walking trail that led to location of site. Access was on public land with start of site right at edge of public and private.

Extensive notes taken with timestamps in Al’s book. From start location down to Bridge over Buck Creek. Location of prescription from Nadina 1998 buck 4 1 implemented naturally with seven log structure forming right at the corner. Several other very deep pools throughout the area surveyed with sections of exceptional mature mixed Forest rep Ryan. Abundant gravel present suitable for Chinook and Cole spawning with pools deep enough to hold large fish during staging as well as support juvenile rearing and resident adult rearing throughout the winter. 2024-10-01T20:18:00Z,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,Buck Creek,buck_lower,6,8.2,215,clear,moderate,,,9,,,12,70,2024-10-01T20:25:56Z,12.5,16,2024-10-01T20:37:24Z,14,17.5,2024-10-01T20:46:27Z,9,20,2024-10-01T21:10:54Z,17,21,2024-10-01T21:56:39Z,13.5,36,2024-10-01T22:08:25Z,,,,0.5,2024-10-01T20:37:29Z,1,2024-10-01T20:50:53Z,1,2024-10-01T21:09:23Z,1,2024-10-01T21:13:46Z,2,2024-10-01T20:25:41Z,0.6,2024-10-01T20:32:45Z,1.2,2024-10-01T20:51:00Z,2,2024-10-01T21:18:55Z,1.6,2024-10-01T22:01:13Z,,,,,0.9,2024-10-01T20:44:51Z,0.95,2024-10-01T22:08:59Z,,,,,cobbles,boulders,"Site was accessed from the cemetery and surveyed down to the approximate boundary of Reach 1 and Reach 2 according to the chainage provided in Nadina report 1998.  Numerous large bedrock features for the first 1 km with deep pools associated.  Occasional large woody debris.  Lower 1 km was mostly simplified with some riparian  removal however never completely stripped as numerous riparian trees still present.  Large riprap wall along right bank near bottom of site.  Log jam with associated deep pool at bottom end of site.

",,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,sloping,cobbles,,mixed forest,mature forest,V-shaped,cobbles,,mixed forest,mature forest,,,riffle-pool,irregular meanders,Decoupled,occasionally confined,,,,Ai,,2100,,,,,,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241001_150258.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241001_150217.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241001_150305.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241001_150310.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20241001_135338.jpg,Buck 2 1 ds,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20241001_150412.jpg,Bedrock corner ,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-10-01T22:07:42Z,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,newgraph_airvine,Buck Creek,Buck lower2,,,,,,,,9,,,8,30,2024-10-01T22:17:51Z,16,20,2024-10-01T22:30:03Z,14,19,2024-10-01T22:48:10Z,11,26,,13,14.5,2024-10-01T22:58:47Z,11,16,2024-10-01T23:04:18Z,,,,1,2024-10-01T22:30:07Z,0.5,2024-10-01T22:54:55Z,,,,,1.4,2024-10-01T23:09:25Z,0.9,2024-10-01T23:17:39Z,1.2,2024-10-01T23:20:30Z,,,,,,,,,0.9,,,,,,,,cobbles,gravels," Surveyed from approximate location of the upstream end of reach one.  The entire section surveyed with the exception of the bottom 300-500m was very channelized with primarily straight riffle habitat.  Once the stream entered the floodplain of the Buckley River, logjams have caused the stream to cut through the old growth cottonwood forest, resulting in deep narrow channel with abundant large debris and some beaver activity.  Several deep pools in the downstream 300-500 m however no pools and virtually no large debris in the entire rest of the survey area.

It appears as though the UTMs provided in Nadina 1998 for prescription locations for buck_1_1 and buck_1_2 may be incorrect as the chainage does not coincide with the location of the UTMs.  Both prescriptions describe complexing channelized habitat using riffles and rock.  No fish observed in entire survey.
